intro: Scleria notoptera, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Scleria notoptera is typically found in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
